lead_paragraph: The former Northern Colorado backup punter Mitch Cozad was sentenced to seven years in prison for stabbing a teammate in what prosecutors said was a brutal attempt to take over the starter’s role. Prosecutors said Cozad ambushed the starting punter, Rafael Mendoza, on the night of Sept. 11, 2006. Cozad was convicted in August of second-degree assault but acquitted of the more serious charge of attempted first-degree murder.
